1   /**
2    * BSD-style license; for more info see http://pmd.sourceforge.net/license.html
3    */
4   
5   package net.sourceforge.pmd.cache;
6   
7   import java.io.File;
8   import java.util.List;
9   
10  import net.sourceforge.pmd.RuleSets;
11  import net.sourceforge.pmd.RuleViolation;
12  import net.sourceforge.pmd.ThreadSafeReportListener;
13  import net.sourceforge.pmd.annotation.InternalApi;
14  
15  /**
16   * An analysis cache for incremental analysis.
17   * Simultaneously manages the old version of the cache,
18   * and the new, most up-to-date violation cache.
19   *
20   * @deprecated This is internal API, will be hidden with 7.0.0
21   */
22  @Deprecated
23  @InternalApi
24  public interface AnalysisCache extends ThreadSafeReportListener {
25  
26      /**
27       * Persists the updated analysis results on whatever medium is used by the cache.
28       */
29      void persist();
30  
31      /**
32       * Checks if a given file is up to date in the cache and can be skipped from analysis.
33       * Regardless of the return value of this method, each call adds the parameter to the
34       * updated cache, which allows {@link #ruleViolationAdded(RuleViolation)} to add a rule
35       * violation to the file. TODO is this really best behaviour? This side-effects seems counter-intuitive.
36       *
37       * @param sourceFile The file to check in the cache
38       * @return True if the cache is a hit, false otherwise
39       */
40      boolean isUpToDate(File sourceFile);
41  
42      /**
43       * Retrieves cached violations for the given file. Make sure to call {@link #isUpToDate(File)} first.
44       * @param sourceFile The file to check in the cache
45       * @return The list of cached violations.
46       */
47      List<RuleViolation> getCachedViolations(File sourceFile);
48  
49      /**
50       * Notifies the cache that analysis of the given file has failed and should not be cached.
51       * @param sourceFile The file whose analysis failed
52       */
53      void analysisFailed(File sourceFile);
54      
55      /**
56       * Checks if the cache is valid for the configured rulesets and class loader.
57       * If the provided rulesets and classpath don't match those of the cache, the
58       * cache is invalidated. This needs to be called before analysis, as it
59       * conditions the good behaviour of {@link #isUpToDate(File)}.
60       *
61       * @param ruleSets The rulesets configured for this analysis.
62       * @param auxclassPathClassLoader The class loader for auxclasspath configured for this analysis.
63       */
64      void checkValidity(RuleSets ruleSets, ClassLoader auxclassPathClassLoader);
65  }
